title: Asylum agreement between US and El Salvador is ready to go into effect
description: An asylum agreement between the United States and El Salvador is ready to go into effect, according to a memo obtained by CNN.

title: Russia's Navalny says he is '100% sure' Putin ordered elite team to trail him before poisoning
description: Russian opposition figure Alexey Navalny has told CNN that he is certain Russian leader Vladimir Putin knew of an elaborate shadowing operation by elite agents before he was poisoned.

title: MacKenzie Scott donates $4.2 billion to 384 organizations
description: MacKenzie Scott announced on Tuesday her second major charitable contribution of the year, giving away nearly $4.2 billion to 384 organizations as part of a plan to donate a majority of her fortune.

title: Ghislaine Maxwell seeks release from jail on a proposed $28.5 million bail package
description: Ghislaine Maxwell, accused of being an accomplice to alleged sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein, is asking to be released on a proposed $28.5 million bail package, according to court documents.

title: Trump Organization must turn over documents to NY attorney general, judge rules
description: A state judge ruled Tuesday that the Trump Organization must turn over documents related to a property whose tax abatements were being investigated by New York Attorney General Letitia James' office.

title: Kelly Clarkson tears up at pupil's song on 'The Voice'
description: Kelly Clarkson cried while praising her pupil and "The Voice" contestant, DeSz, for her original song on the season 19 finale.

title: See this airline's new Covid-19 'Safety Dance'
description: Alaska Airlines wants you to fly with them -- so much so, that they're willing to dance for you. The airline showed off its Covid-19 safety precautions with a new music video.

title: Doctor learns she lost patient while on her way to get vaccine
description: As Dr. Valerie Briones-Pryor was on her way to get the Covid-19 vaccine, she learned she lost her 27th patient to the virus. She speaks with CNN's Dana Bash about the experience.

title: Hungary passes anti-LGBTQ law effectively barring same-sex couples from adopting
description: Hungary's parliament has voted to redefine the concept of "family" in the country's constitution, a move that will effectively bar same sex couples from adopting children. The move has been met with outcry from human rights groups and LGBTQ advocates.

title: Putin finally congratulates Biden on US election victory
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin congratulated Joe Biden on his victory in the US presidential election Tuesday, six weeks after the vote and a day after the Electoral College officially affirmed Biden's win.

title: Hayabusa2 mission confirms return of an asteroid sample, including gas, to Earth
description: The Hayabusa2 mission successfully collected a sample from a near-Earth asteroid and returned it to Earth -- as well as the first gas sample from deep space, according to the Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency, or JAXA.

title: Meghan, The Duchess of Sussex honors communities responding to America's food crisis
description: Meghan, The Duchess of Sussex pays tribute to the people working to ensure that Americans have food during the pandemic. Get involved: CNNHeroes.com.

title: Fox News' Geraldo Rivera tells Trump to stand down: 'It's over'
description: Geraldo Rivera, a Fox News correspondent and longtime friend of Donald Trump, has a message for the president: "It's over."

title: Keilar: There's no path for Trump, it's a brick wall
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar talks about the many GOP officials who said they would acknowledge Joe Biden as president-elect after the electoral college voted and have yet to recognize the win a day after the vote.

title: YouTuber Jake Paul offers UFC fighter Conor McGregor $50 million to box him
description: YouTuber Jake Paul is trying to capitalize on his initial success in the boxing ring by challenging former UFC champion Conor McGregor.

title: The FDA authorizes a fully at-home test as more Covid-19 patients are hospitalized than ever before
Anna Wintour has long reigned supreme at Condé Nast. Now it's official
description: Anna Wintour now has an even loftier title at Condé Nast.

title: This Republican senator apparently has no idea what a 'gotcha' question actually is
description: After the Electoral College -- as expected -- confirmed Monday that Joe Biden will be the 46th president of the United States, a reporter asked Wyoming Sen. John Barrasso whether or not Biden was now officially the "President-elect." Barrasso called it a "gotcha" question.

title: Europe threatens to break up Big Tech if it doesn't play by new rules
description: Officials across Europe on Tuesday unveiled legislation that would give regulators sweeping new powers to take on US tech giants, threatening huge fines and raising the prospect of breakups or bans for repeat offenders.

title: Ford's Mustang Mach-E electric SUV is awesome, but Tesla still has one big advantage
description: A lot could have gone wrong when Ford decided to make a four-door electric crossover SUV and call it a Mustang, and even boldly put a pony badge on its nose.

title: Thief steals pocket watch worth nearly $27,000 gifted by former US President
description: A pocket watch worth up to nearly $27,000 that was presented by US President Woodrow Wilson has been stolen from an antiques dealer in London, police have said.

title: Pornhub removes a majority of its videos after investigation reveals child abuse
description: Pornhub has removed a majority of its content -- millions of explicit videos -- uploaded from unverified users as part of a series of changes following allegations that the site showed videos of child abuse and nonconsensual sexual behavior.

title: Britney Spears' father speaks out as she requests to remove him as conservator of her estate
description: Legal proceedings in Britney Spears' conservatorship battle had remained relatively private over the past year, but that changed during a dramatic hearing last month in which Spears' attorney, Samuel D. Ingham III, stated that his client was "afraid" of her father, Jamie Spears​, and accused him of making business decisions without her knowledge. According to court documents obtained by CNN, Ingham said the pop star would not perform again as long as her father remains in control of her estimated $60 million estate.

title: See total solar eclipse in parts of South America
description: A total solar eclipse was seen in Chile and Argentina as the moon moved completely in front of the sun to create this year's one and only total eclipse.

title: This robotaxi from Amazon's Zoox has no reverse function
description: This self-driving robotaxi from Amazon's Zoox can travel up to 75 mph and never has to turn around. Check out this electric vehicle made for crowded city streets.

title: From steak to McDonald's: His earnings have disappeared
description: Harry Mason, known by his stage name Sasha Cassadine, went from a lucrative career in drag, to not knowing where his next paycheck was coming from during the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Why Italy is building 1,500 wooden vaccination pavillions adorned with flower graphics
description: Hundreds of timber vaccination pavilions, adorned with a flower graphic meant to symbolize regeneration, are set to be installed around Italy from January as the country starts immunizing its population with a Covid-19 vaccine.

title: Taylor Swift debunks fan theories about a third surprise album
description: Sorry Swifties, "Woodvale" doesn't mean what you might think.

title: See what this year's Hanukkah is like in Israel
description: The threat of a third Covid-19 lockdown looms over Hanukkah celebrations in Israel making it a very different holiday this year. Elliott Gotkine reports from Israel.

title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle sign exclusive podcast deal with Spotify
description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle are podcasters now.

title: 'I'm 9 months into this nightmare': Covid-19 long-hauler
description: Abby Gresko Barclay speaks to CNN's Alisyn Camerota about her experience as a coronavirus long hauler and shares what it's like to experience coronavirus symptoms for 9-months, calling it a "nightmare."

title: Senator: It's 'gravely concerning' Putin congratulated Biden before McConnell
description: Sen. Chris Coons (D-DE) discusses President-elect Joe Biden's speech following the Electoral College's affirmation of his victory and the fact that Russian President Vladimir Putin has congratulated Biden before Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell has.

title: 'A game that 'will go down in history:' Baltimore Ravens beat Cleveland Browns with last-gasp field goal
description: It's been a disappointing year for Lamar Jackson and the Baltimore Ravens. But a stunning last gasp 47-42 win against their division rival Cleveland Browns might just spark a thrilling end to the season for the team.

title: Anglo-Saxon cross buried for 1,000 years seen in stunning detail for the first time
description: The intricate decoration of an ancient Anglo-Saxon silver cross buried for more than a millennium has been revealed for the first time, adding greater detail to one of Britain's most remarkable archaeological finds.

title: What's gone wrong at Ferrari and can Formula One's most successful team bounce back in 2021?
description: With 13th and 14th placed finishes in Sunday's Abu Dhabi Grand Prix, Scuderia Ferrari recorded its worst season since 1980. It has been a disastrous year.

title: Ex-GOP governor praises Biden for these two speech moments
description: Former Governor of Ohio John Kasich (R) discusses how the Republican Party is feeling after the Electoral College formally affirms Joe Biden's presidential win.

title: A 'frozen rainforest' of microscopic life is melting Greenland's ice sheet
description: When Joseph Cook first landed on the Greenland ice sheet in 2010, he was expecting to see a pristine white environment. What he found was a "colorful patchwork" -- from blacks and grays to greens, purples and browns, with neon blue melt streams cutting through the ice.

title: The first public Covid-19 vaccines reach all 50 states as the US death toll tops 300,000
description: • LIVE: US reports record number of new Covid-19 cases

title: Pinterest settles gender discrimination lawsuit for $22.5 million
description: Pinterest has agreed to settle a gender discrimination and retaliation lawsuit brought by its former chief operating officer, Francoise Brougher, for $22.5 million.

title: Wisconsin Department of Health warns against eating the 'cannibal sandwich,' a traditional holiday dish in the state
description: Wisconsin residents are being urged by health officials to pass on eating a traditional holiday dish this year to avoid getting sick.

title: After the Electoral College affirmed his victory, the US President-elect said "the will of the people prevailed" over Trump's efforts to undo the election
description: President-elect Joe Biden declared Monday, hours after the Electoral College made his victory over President Donald Trump official, that "the rule of law, our Constitution and the will of the people prevailed" over Trump's efforts to undo the results of the election.

title: Why tens of thousands of Australians will be stranded abroad this Christmas
description: Anxious, angry and abandoned. Less than two weeks from Christmas, at least 39,000 Australian citizens and permanent residents are still stranded overseas due to Australia's international arrival caps.

title: London returns to strict lockdown, following a sharp rise in coronavirus cases
description: A new variant of Covid-19 has been identified in the southeast of England, UK Health Secretary Matt Hancock said Monday, as he announced that London would return to a strict lockdown this week, after coronavirus cases there soared.

title: Covid-19 now kills more than 1 American every minute. It's accelerating as death toll tops 300,000
